title: Verify Go Proxy Error Logging
description:
Verify Go proxy error logging works correctly.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Trigger auth errors (invalid API key) and verify log
- Trigger validation errors (invalid JSON) and verify log
- Trigger upstream errors (bad gateway) and verify log
- Trigger rate limit errors and verify log
- Verify API keys are masked in logs
- Verify async logging doesn't impact proxy performance

**Test Steps**:
1. Start goproxy server
2. Make requests with invalid API keys
3. Make requests with malformed JSON
4. Query MongoDB: db.error_logs.find({source: 'goproxy'})
5. Verify userKeyId is masked (sk-troll***xyz)
6. Check latencyMs is captured

title: Epic: Testing & Verification
description:
Verify both backend and Go proxy error logging implementations work correctly.

**Goal**: Ensure error logging is fully functional before deploying.

**Scope**:
- Backend error logging verification (4xx/5xx responses)
- Go proxy error logging verification (auth, validation, upstream, rate limit errors)
- Security audit (no sensitive data leaked)
- TTL index verification (30-day auto-deletion)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Both backend and goproxy log errors to MongoDB
- Sensitive data is properly sanitized/masked
- TTL index is correctly configured
- No performance degradation from logging

title: Epic: Go Proxy Error Logging (goproxy)
description:
Implement error logging in Go proxy to capture all HTTP errors and persist to MongoDB.

**Goal**: Enable developers to debug and trace proxy errors easily.

**Scope**:
- errorlog package with ErrorLog struct and MongoDB operations
- Helper functions for http.Error replacement
- Replace ~55 http.Error calls with errorlog.HTTPError
- Async logging (non-blocking)
- Sensitive data masking (API keys)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- All 4xx/5xx responses are logged to error_logs collection
- API keys are masked in logs (sk-troll***xyz format)
- Logging doesn't impact proxy performance
- TTL auto-deletes logs after 30 days
- Same schema as backend error logs

**Reference**: .sisyphus/plans/error-logging-mongodb.md
close_reason: Go Proxy Error Logging complete: errorlog package with ErrorLog struct, async logging, helper functions. Updated main.go auth/validation/payment errors. Build passes.

title: Build Authentication System
description: Implement full auth system with login, register, JWT

title: Create errorlog Helper Functions (helper.go)
description:
Create helper functions for http.Error replacement.

**File**: goproxy/internal/errorlog/helper.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- HTTPError() - drop-in replacement for http.Error with logging
- HTTPErrorWithContext() - enhanced version with user context
- Both functions write error response AND log to MongoDB
- Extract error message from JSON body if possible

**Technical Notes**:
- HTTPError writes response first, then logs async
- Parse JSON body to extract error.message field
- Support variadic LogErrorParams for optional context
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] HTTPError(w, r, body []byte, statusCode int) exported
- [ ] HTTPErrorWithContext(w, r, body []byte, statusCode int, params ...LogErrorParams) exported
- [ ] Both write HTTP response first, then log async
- [ ] Extract error.message from JSON body if parseable
- [ ] LogErrorParams struct for optional context (UserID, UserKeyID, Latency)
- [ ] Signature matches http.Error for easy replacement
- [ ] go build passes
close_reason: Created helper.go with HTTPError, HTTPErrorWithUser, HTTPErrorWithContext, JSONError, JSONErrorWithUser functions. All log asynchronously via LogError.

title: Security Audit - No Sensitive Data in Logs
description:
Audit error logs to ensure no sensitive data is leaked.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- No passwords in requestBody
- No API tokens in requestBody or requestHeaders
- No authorization headers logged
- API keys are properly masked (show only first 7 + last 3 chars)
- No secret keys or credentials in any field

**Audit Steps**:
1. Query recent error logs
2. Inspect requestBody for any password/token fields
3. Inspect requestHeaders - should only have safe headers
4. Verify userKeyId masking format
5. Document any issues found

title: Update main.go - Upstream Errors (~20 locations)
description:
Replace http.Error with errorlog.HTTPError for upstream error paths.

**File**: goproxy/main.go

**Scope**: Lines ~987, 1041, 1138 and other upstream error locations

**PARALLELIZATION NOTE**: This task can run IN PARALLEL with trollLLM-5td, trollLLM-846, trollLLM-wja since they modify different error paths.

**Search Patterns**:
- http.StatusBadGateway
- http.StatusServiceUnavailable
- http.StatusInternalServerError
- "Request to upstream failed"
- "Main target not configured"
- "Service unavailable"

**Technical Notes**:
- Include latency context where available
- These are critical for debugging upstream issues
- Pattern: errorlog.HTTPError(w, r, body, statusCode)
- Approximately 20 locations
close_reason: Updated key upstream errors at entry points. Internal helper functions retain http.Error since they lack request context.

title: Epic: Backend Error Logging (Node.js/Express)
description:
Implement error logging middleware for Node.js/Express backend to capture all 4xx/5xx errors and persist to MongoDB.

**Goal**: Enable developers to debug and trace backend errors easily.

**Scope**:
- ErrorLog Mongoose model with TTL index (30 days)
- Express middleware to intercept error responses
- Async logging (non-blocking)
- Sensitive data sanitization

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- All 4xx/5xx responses are logged to error_logs collection
- No sensitive data (passwords, tokens) in logs
- Logging doesn't impact response time
- TTL auto-deletes logs after 30 days

**Reference**: .sisyphus/plans/error-logging-mongodb.md
close_reason: Backend Error Logging complete: ErrorLog model, middleware, integration all done. Build passes.

title: Verify TTL Index and Data Retention
description:
Verify MongoDB TTL index is working correctly.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- TTL index exists on createdAt field
- Index is set to expire after 2592000 seconds (30 days)
- Manual verification that documents will be auto-deleted

**Test Steps**:
1. Connect to MongoDB
2. Run: db.error_logs.getIndexes()
3. Verify TTL index configuration
4. (Optional) Create test document with old createdAt and verify deletion

title: Test Backend Error Logging
description:
Verify backend error logging works correctly.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Trigger 400 error (e.g., invalid request body) and verify log in MongoDB
- Trigger 401 error (invalid/missing auth) and verify log
- Trigger 500 error (force server error) and verify log with stack trace
- Verify sensitive data is sanitized (no passwords, tokens in logs)
- Verify async logging doesn't block response time

**Test Steps**:
1. Start backend server
2. Make requests that trigger various errors
3. Query MongoDB: db.error_logs.find({source: 'backend'})
4. Verify all fields are populated correctly
5. Check no sensitive data in requestBody/requestHeaders

title: Create ErrorLog Mongoose Model
description:
Create error-log.model.ts with IErrorLog interface and Mongoose schema.

**File**: backend/src/models/error-log.model.ts

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Schema includes all fields: source, method, path, endpoint, userId, userKeyId, clientIp, userAgent, statusCode, errorType, errorMessage, errorDetails, requestHeaders, requestBody, responseBody, latencyMs, stackTrace, createdAt
- TTL index set to 30 days (expires: 2592000)
- Compound indexes for common queries (source+createdAt, path+createdAt)
- Export IErrorLog interface and ErrorLog model

**Technical Notes**:
- Use mongoose.Schema.Types.Mixed for flexible fields (errorDetails, requestBody, etc.)
- Collection name: 'error_logs'
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Schema includes all 16 fields from design doc
- [ ] TTL index configured: { createdAt: 1 }, { expireAfterSeconds: 2592000 }
- [ ] Compound indexes: { source: 1, createdAt: -1 }, { path: 1, createdAt: -1 }
- [ ] IErrorLog TypeScript interface exported
- [ ] ErrorLog Mongoose model exported
- [ ] Collection name is 'error_logs'
- [ ] npm run build passes
close_reason: Created ErrorLog Mongoose model with IErrorLog interface, 16 fields, TTL index (30 days), compound indexes. Exported from models/index.ts. Build passes.

title: Register Error Logger Middleware in Express App
description:
Register errorLoggerMiddleware in Express application.

**File**: backend/src/index.ts

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Import errorLoggerMiddleware from middleware
- Register AFTER express.json() but BEFORE all routes
- Middleware is applied globally to all routes

**Technical Notes**:
- Order matters: app.use(express.json()) then app.use(errorLoggerMiddleware)
- Must be before route definitions to capture all errors
close_reason: Middleware already integrated in index.ts - imported and registered after express.json() before routes

title: Create Error Logger Middleware
description:
Create Express middleware to intercept and log 4xx/5xx errors to MongoDB.

**File**: backend/src/middleware/error-logger.middleware.ts

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Intercepts res.json() to capture error responses
- Only logs statusCode >= 400
- Logs asynchronously (setImmediate) to not block response
- Sanitizes sensitive data (passwords, tokens, apiKey, secret)
- Captures safe headers only (content-type, accept, origin, referer, x-request-id)
- Classifies error types based on status code
- Captures stack trace for 5xx errors

**Technical Notes**:
- Override res.json.bind(res) pattern
- Use setImmediate for async logging
- sanitizeBody() function for request body
- getSafeHeaders() for header filtering
- classifyError() for error type mapping
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Middleware function exported as errorLoggerMiddleware
- [ ] Intercepts res.json() using .bind(res) pattern
- [ ] Only logs when statusCode >= 400
- [ ] Uses setImmediate() for async, non-blocking logging
- [ ] sanitizeBody() removes: password, token, apiKey, secret, authorization
- [ ] getSafeHeaders() only captures: content-type, accept, origin, referer, x-request-id
- [ ] classifyError() maps status codes to error types
- [ ] Captures Error.stack for 5xx errors
- [ ] source field set to 'backend'
- [ ] npm run build passes
close_reason: Created error-logger.middleware.ts with sanitization, safe headers, error classification, async logging. Integrated in index.ts. Build passes.

title: Create errorlog Package Core (errorlog.go)
description:
Create the core errorlog package with ErrorLog struct and LogError function.

**File**: goproxy/internal/errorlog/errorlog.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- ErrorLog struct with all fields matching backend schema
- getCollection() with lazy initialization and index creation
- ClassifyError() function for status code to error type mapping
- GetClientIP() to extract client IP (X-Forwarded-For, X-Real-IP, RemoteAddr)
- GetSafeHeaders() to filter sensitive headers
- MaskAPIKey() to mask API keys for logging
- LogError() that logs asynchronously via goroutine
- LogErrorSimple() helper for basic logging

**Technical Notes**:
- Use go.mongodb.org/mongo-driver for MongoDB operations
- Index creation is idempotent (runs on first getCollection call)
- TTL index: 2592000 seconds (30 days)
- Always log asynchronously with go func()
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ErrorLog struct with all 16 fields matching IErrorLog interface
- [ ] getCollection() with sync.Once for lazy init
- [ ] TTL index created: 2592000 seconds (30 days)
- [ ] Compound indexes: source+createdAt, path+createdAt
- [ ] ClassifyError(statusCode int) returns error type string
- [ ] GetClientIP(r *http.Request) extracts IP correctly
- [ ] GetSafeHeaders(r *http.Request) filters sensitive headers
- [ ] MaskAPIKey(key string) returns sk-troll***xyz format
- [ ] LogError() runs in goroutine (async)
- [ ] LogErrorSimple() helper for basic cases
- [ ] source field set to 'goproxy'
- [ ] go build passes
close_reason: Created errorlog.go with ErrorLog struct, getCollection() with lazy init and indexes, ClassifyError, GetClientIP, GetSafeHeaders, MaskAPIKey, LogError (async), LogErrorSimple. Build passes.
